programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: New York won its last two home meetings with Washington after a 4-1 victory on April 6 behind two goals from Marc Gatcomb and 28 saves from Iyla Sorokin; Alex Ovechkin scored the lone goal for the Capitals to surpass Wayne Gretzky's goal record.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: New York won its last two home meetings with Washington after a 4-1 victory on April 6 behind two goals from Marc Gatcomb and 28 saves from Iyla Sorokin; Alex Ovechkin scored the lone goal for the Capitals to surpass Wayne Gretzky's goal record.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Seattle won its last two meetings with Los Angeles, including a 2-1 win on April 7 behind goals from Matty Beniers and Brandon Montour, after losing four of the previous five to the Kings, who got a goal from Quinton Byfield in the loss.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Chicago won all three regular-season meetings with Miami, including a 119-111 home win on April 9 behind a 28-point triple-double from Josh Giddey, along with 20 points from Nikola Vucevic, who was two assists shy of his own triple-double.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: The premier open-wheel racing organization, Formula 1 originated in 1950 as the top drivers traveled around the world to compete for the series championship, gaining points at each stop based upon their finish in the fast-paced races.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Juárez and Necaxa had played to draws in three consecutive meetings before Necaxa claimed a 3-0 win in their most recent matchup from the Apertura season on Aug. 24; Alan Montes won a penalty for the opener and added his own strike in the win.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bowlers compete for a $100,000 top prize in the final; Bill O'Neill captured the 14th title and the third major PBA championship of his career with a 209-178 victory over top-seeded Tom Smallwood in last year's edition held in Wichita, Kan.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Probable starters: Bryce Miller (0-2, 4.50) vs. Nick Martinez (0-2, 6.06); Miller allowed just two hits over five innings against Texas in his last start for the Mariners, and Martinez struck out eight Giants in 5.2 innings on April 9 for the Reds.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Two-time champion Francesco Bagnaia secured his first win of the season with his victory at COTA, while Alex Marquez passed his brother, Marc, in the standings by one point; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Qatar last year over Brad Binder.

programme.desc: Juárez and Necaxa had played to draws in three consecutive meetings before Necaxa claimed a 3-0 win in their most recent matchup from the Apertura season on Aug. 24; Alan Montes won a penalty for the opener and added his own strike in the win.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Nebraska (16-20) comes off a 6-4 win over Iowa on April 13; Creighton (20-11) has won 12 of the past 14 meetings with the Cornhuskers, including a 9-5 road victory on April 1, as Jack Torosian hit a two-run triple in the ninth inning.
